DERBY-2371: Altering VARCHAR default fails when column contains data
Merged trunk revision 512019 to the 10.2 branch. Description of change:
Using ALTER TABLE to modify the default value for a VARCHAR column when the column already contains data throws ERROR 22018: Invalid character string format for type long.
The problem arises in AlterTableConstantAction.modifyColumnDefault, which only understands two types of modifications that can be made to a column's default value: - changing the INCREMENT BY value for a generated IDENTITY column - changing the RESTART WITH value for a generated IDENTITY column
But there is a third type of modification that can be made to a column's default value, which is simply to change the default value that is to be used for an ordinary column if no value is provided when inserting a new row into that table.
The fix is to add a new ColumnInfo modification type code: MODIFY_COLUMN_DEFAULT_VALUE and to teach ModifyColumnNode and AlterTableConstantAction what to do for modifications of type MODIFY_COLUMN_DEFAULT_VALUE.
